But rather than giving up on the technology altogether, the most advanced organizations are experimenting with agentic AI systems that can learn and be supervised. That’s where From comes in. external.description: Microsoft’un yapay zekâ asistanı Copilot, Windows ve Microsoft 365 uygulamalarındaki kullanımının ardından artık televizyon ekranlarına taşınıyor. Şirket, 2025 çıkışlı Samsung TV modellerinde Copilot’un yer alacağını açıkladı. Böylece televizyon karşısında oturan kullanıcılar, sesli komutlarla bilgi alabilecek, film tavsiyesi isteyebilecek ve izledikleri içeriklerle ilgili sohbet edebilecek. Copilot’un ekranda beliren renkli damlacık tasarımı, kullanıcıya yalnızca bir asistan değil, aynı zamanda dijital bir karakter deneyimi yaşatıyor.

I'm not claiming MS is doing this, but I have knowledge of companies taking liberties with the definition of a "user".

One could e.g. count the number of users of a product that includes copilot, and report those numbers to investors as if they were users of copilot.

Microsoft is trying to pad its copilot user counts.

Investors have poured eye-watering sums of money into LLMs, and are going to want to see evidence that there will be a return.

MS needs to show them that many users rely on copilot, which means they need to push it.

author.display_name: だっしー（だし屋のマルサヤ）

value.text:
＼お昼の暇つブシ／

つらつら更新中の画像から、今日は「利尻昆布」について。

利尻昆布は利尻島近郊で採取される昆布の総称で、北海道本当側で採られたものも利尻昆布と言われます（いわゆる "地方-じかた" ）

利尻島ならびに礼文島で採られた利尻昆布は「島物」と称され、とりわけ上質なものとして、主に料亭など純和食の世界で重宝されています（画像左上のピンクの島。上が礼文島で下が利尻島）

さらにはその島のどこの浜で採られたかによっても細かく分類されていきます

さらにさらに、蔵に囲って寝かせたいわゆるヒネものという熟成昆布もあり、昆布の世界も大変深い深い沼となっております

Let's be honest: translations generated by AI often result in awful translations — full of grammatical errors, clumsy phrasing, word salad, broken stilted dialogue etc.

Translated manga needs proofreaders and leterrers. But for these illiterate clods, A.I. is the solution.

Yeah, that's BS.

In fact, that guy shot himself in the foot when he said "A.I. translates slang 1:1". What that guy said is that "every slang, idiom and vernacular would be translated LITERALLY."

THIS is exactly what A.I. does.

And it's basically glorified machine translation, which is much worse.

There's even one guy on Twitter who asked me "Can you translated better than artificial intelligence?" Then he finally lost it when I told him that a 1:1 translation done by AI would likely DESTROY the messages of the original work, which is true. All counts.

負傷続く日本代表選手たちの米国遠征メンバー発表と最新状況 - AIサッカーまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description:
日本サッカー協会（JFA）は28日に千葉市で会見を行い、9月の米国遠征（6日にメキシコ戦、9日に米国戦）に臨む日本代表のメンバー25人を発表した。  
負傷者が相次ぐDFには、町田浩樹や伊藤洋輝などが選ばれ、荒木隼人や安藤智哉もメンバーに含まれた。  
荒木はリーグ戦28試合に出場し3得点を記録し、代表でも3試合に出場している。  
安藤は26試合に出場し4得点、板倉滉はコンディション不良で代表入りを見送られた。  
板倉はヘラクレス戦でベンチ外となっている。  
最終ラインの選考について森保監督は、選手たちに無理をさせず、早期回復と充実したプレーを願う思いを伝えた。  
チーム編成については、「ベストを尽くすこと」とし、「何が最善か、成長のためにどうするか」を重視し、良い結果を目指すと述べた。  
町田はブンデスリーグのデビュー戦で左膝前十字靱帯断裂の怪我を負い、手術が必要と発表された。  
また、冨安健洋や高井幸大らも代表から離脱しており、谷口彰悟はアキレス腱断裂からの復帰直後だった。

record.text:
日本代表9月米国遠征メンバーと監督の意気込み - AIサッカーまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description:
日本サッカー協会（JFA）は28日、千葉市内で、9月の米国遠征に臨む日本代表メンバー25人を発表した。  
怪我人が相次ぐ中、遠藤航、三笘薫、久保建英などのMF／FW陣が選ばれた。  
指揮官の森保一監督は、北米ワールドカップ共催国との対戦に向けて、「これまでやってきたことを確認し、素晴らしい対戦相手」と意気込みを語った。  
親善試合ではあるが、勝利を目指し最善の準備と努力を続ける決意を示した。  
選出メンバーには、GKでは早川友基、大迫啓介、鈴木彩艶が名を連ね、DFは長友佑都、荒木隼人、板倉滉、渡辺剛、安藤智哉、瀬古歩夢、関根大輝が含まれる。  
MF／FW陣には遠藤航、伊東純也、南野拓実、三笘薫、小川航基、前田大然、堂安律、上田綺世、町野修斗、佐野海舟、久保建英、細谷真大、望月ヘンリー海輝、鈴木唯人、藤田譲瑠チマが選ばれた。  
怪我の状況を踏まえ、若手から海外経験豊富な選手まで幅広く選出されている。

record.text:
移籍の誘惑と失敗例から学ぶサッカークラブの賢い判断 - AIサッカーまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description:
サッカーにおいて移籍は依然として多くのファンを惹きつける魅力的なテーマであり、移籍情報に熱狂する熱心なフォロワーも多い。  
しかし、多くの選手が長期的にチームを向上させるわけではなく、時には逆効果となるケースも少なくない。  
これまでの失敗例には傲慢さや浪費、楽観的な思考が見られ、安易な大金投入の危険性を教えてくれている。  
この記事は、特にイングランドの移籍市場に絞り、誤った判断に走りやすいクラブや経営陣に警鐘を鳴らす内容だ。  
例えば、パルマからリーズへのトーマス・ブロリンの移籍（1995年、£4.5m）も、その一例として紹介されている。  
これらの事例から得られる教訓を踏まえ、移籍に慎重な判断を促す必要がある。  
重要なのは、移籍による短期的な興奮や投資は必ずしも成功に結びつかないことを認識することだ。  
クラブ経営陣やフットボール関係者は過去の失敗例を学び、安易な決断を避けるべきだと提言している。

record.text: TransBnk Secures $25M to Transform India's Corporate Banking #SpectralNews #News

external.description:
TransBnk, a trailblazer in the realm of financial technology, has successfully secured $25 million in a funding round led by Bessemer Venture Partners. This significant infusion of capital marks a pivotal step in the company’s mission to revolutionize corporate banking in India through digitization.

The Indian corporate banking sector, historically characterized by cumbersome processes and a lack of technological integration, is ripe for innovation. TransBnk aims to address these challenges by leveraging advanced technology to streamline operations for businesses. With this latest funding, the company plans to enhance its platform, providing a seamless digital experience that caters specifically to corporate clients.

Bessemer Venture Partners, known for its strategic investments in transformative technology companies, recognizes the potential of TransBnk to reshape the financial landscape in India. The firm has a history of backing companies that redefine industries, and this investment aligns with its goal of fostering innovation in the fintech space.

TransBnk's platform seeks to simplify various banking processes, allowing corporations to manage their finances with greater efficiency. From automated payment systems to real-time financial analytics, the startup's solutions are designed to alleviate the burdens that many businesses face when dealing with traditional banking institutions.

India's corporate banking sector is undergoing a significant transformation, driven by a growing demand for digital solutions. As businesses increasingly prioritize agility and efficiency, the need for a modern banking infrastructure has never been more pressing. TransBnk is positioning itself at the forefront of this shift, offering tools that not only streamline transactions but also provide valuable insights into financial performance.

The infusion of $25 million will enable TransBnk to bolster its technology stack, invest in talent, and expand its market reach. The startup plans to enhance its artificial intelligence capabilities, enabling predictive analytics that can help businesses make informed decisions based on their financial data. This focus on AI will be crucial as companies seek to navigate an increasingly complex economic landscape.

Moreover, TransBnk’s commitment to compliance and security is paramount. As corporate banking involves sensitive financial information, the startup is dedicated to implementing robust security measures and adhering to regulatory standards. This focus on security will be a key differentiator as businesses evaluate digital banking solutions.

The Indian government has also been supportive of the push towards digitization in the banking sector, implementing initiatives to encourage the adoption of technology among financial institutions. Programs aimed at increasing financial inclusion and improving access to banking services have paved the way for startups like TransBnk to thrive.

As part of its growth strategy, TransBnk is exploring partnerships with established banks and financial institutions. By collaborating with traditional players, the startup aims to enhance its service offerings and create a more integrated banking ecosystem. This approach not only benefits TransBnk but also helps traditional banks adapt to the changing landscape of corporate banking.

The fintech sector in India is flourishing, with numerous startups emerging to tackle various pain points in financial services. According to industry reports, investments in Indian fintech companies reached unprecedented levels in recent years, with a notable surge in funding during the pandemic. This trend underscores the urgency for businesses to adopt digital solutions as remote work and online transactions become the norm.

TransBnk’s recent funding round is a testament to the growing investor confidence in the Indian fintech ecosystem. As the company continues to innovate and expand its offerings, it is well-positioned to capture a substantial share of the corporate banking market. The success of this venture could potentially inspire a wave of similar initiatives, further driving the digital transformation of banking in India.

In summary, the $25 million raised by TransBnk represents more than just a financial milestone; it signifies a shift towards a more efficient, technology-driven corporate banking landscape in India. With the backing of Bessemer Venture Partners and a clear vision for the future, TransBnk is set to play a crucial role in redefining how businesses interact with banking services. As the company continues to innovate and expand, it will undoubtedly influence the trajectory of corporate banking, paving the way for a more digital and integrated financial ecosystem. 

In conclusion, as we witness the ongoing evolution of the fintech sector, TransBnk stands out as a beacon of innovation and progress. The company’s commitment to digitizing corporate banking not only enhances operational efficiency for businesses but also contributes to the broader goal of creating a more inclusive and technologically advanced financial landscape in India. With strategic investments and a focus on cutting-edge technology, the future looks promising for TransBnk and the corporate banking sector at large.
external.title: TransBnk Secures $25M to Transform India's Corporate Banking

record.text: Theory that people in fact pick up on this and ChatGPT text triggers latent xenophobia.

There are many possible output heads on top of that shared ontology, the shared ontology does not actually mean you have "alignment by default", but it does mean if you train a good enough model on a bunch of human data you can derive an accurate understanding of existing values, which is a start.

Part of the answer is that in contrast to Yudkowsky's "vast space of minds" thesis there seems to be a limited number of "optimal" convergent representations that hill climbers stumble into under optimization to predict similar corpora. All domains are secretly the Logos.

record.text:
Are ChatGPT’s Favorite Words Creeping Into Daily Conversation? Researchers at Florida State University have reported early signs that artificial intelligence may already be influencing the way pe...

#Business #chart #ChatGPT #language #news #Technology

Origin | Interest | Match

external.description:
Researchers at Florida State University have reported early signs that artificial intelligence may already be influencing the way people speak. Their study examined more than 22 million words taken from unscripted science and technology podcasts and found that certain expressions favored by large language models are appearing more often in casual conversation.

The analysis compared transcripts from before and after the release of ChatGPT in late 2022. The team noted a rise in terms that AI systems frequently use, such as “align,” “strategically,” “surpass,” and “boast.” At the same time, other possible alternatives like “accentuate” or “probe” showed little change, pointing to a selective shift rather than a broad expansion of vocabulary.

**Why the findings matter**

Language has always shifted alongside technology, but the current change appears unusually concentrated and rapid. The study showed that nearly three-quarters of words associated with AI grew in frequency, with some, including “surpass,” more than doubling in usage. The increase was especially strong in spontaneous speech, which suggests the influence is not limited to text generated directly by machines.





The researchers describe this as a problem of model alignment. In their view, linguistic habits built into AI outputs may be drifting into human speech, even when those patterns do not reflect natural preferences.

**How the study was carried out**

Because authorship in written text can be uncertain when AI tools are involved, the team chose to focus on spoken language. They compiled 1,326 podcast episodes from shows such as Lex Fridman, EconTalk, and Radiolab, dividing them evenly between recordings made before and after 2022. Transcripts were then processed with machine learning systems that standardized grammar and marked parts of speech, allowing for comparisons across time.

The results showed that some terms like “delve” rose only slightly, while others, including “align” and “significant,” climbed more consistently. According to the researchers, this selective adoption indicates that people exposed to AI-generated text may be unconsciously echoing its lexical style in conversation.

**Possible consequences**

If these patterns continue, they could create a cycle where human speech begins to reflect AI usage, which in turn feeds back into the training of future systems. The concern is that this seep-in effect could spread beyond vocabulary and affect the way ideas are framed, eventually shaping broader norms of communication.

At the same time, the evidence is not conclusive. Some of the tracked words were already becoming more common before ChatGPT was released, and language often changes within specific subcultures before it spreads more widely. Because the dataset mainly reflects technology-focused speakers, the results may show an early stage of diffusion rather than a broad shift in English overall.

**What comes next**

The Florida State researchers plan to expand their work with larger datasets that include more diverse speech communities. They also emphasize the importance of monitoring how model biases may filter into everyday expression. Their findings will be presented at the upcoming Conference on AI, Ethics, and Society, where the work will be discussed alongside broader questions about fairness and the role of artificial intelligence in daily life.

For now, the study indicates that conversational English is already starting to reflect the vocabulary of AI systems, raising questions about how far machine-generated patterns may reach into human communication.

Notes: This post was edited/created using GenAI tools.

Read next: Language Is Changing Again, and This Time, It's Machines We're Imitating
external.title: Are ChatGPT’s Favorite Words Creeping Into Daily Conversation?

record.text:
Google Brings AI-Powered Avatars to Its Video Tool While Opening Access to Casual Users Google is taking another step into automated video production , extending its Workspace editor Vids with a fr...

#AI #artificial-intelligence #Business #Google #news #Technology #tools

Origin | Interest | Match

external.description:
Google is taking another step into automated video production, extending its Workspace editor Vids with a fresh set of artificial intelligence features while also offering a stripped-down edition for anyone to try. The updates mark an effort to make professional-looking clips easier to produce without the time and cost normally tied to filming.

Rather than requiring a camera crew or actors, the new system lets a script be fed into the editor and then delivered on screen by one of a dozen digital presenters. Each avatar comes with its own look and voice, offering a quick way to create training guides or business explainers. The option was previewed earlier this year and is now broadly available to paying Workspace and education customers, as well as subscribers to Google’s AI plans.




The app also gains tools that handle some of the more tedious editing steps. Vids can now spot filler words such as “uh” or “ah” and cut them, closing up awkward pauses at the same time. Another addition, built on the Veo 3 model, can generate an eight-second animation from a single picture, making it possible to turn a static product image into a short moving clip.

For people who simply want to assemble slides, templates, or stock footage, Google has prepared a free consumer edition. This entry-level version includes the company’s design library and basic controls, but it leaves out the AI-driven functions being offered to business accounts.

Further upgrades are still on the roadmap. Noise cancellation, customizable backgrounds, and new output shapes such as portrait and square are all being worked on, though no release date has been given.

With rivals like Synthesia and D-ID already offering avatar-driven video production to companies, Google is now placing Vids as its own answer, balancing high-end AI options for enterprise users with a lighter tool that anyone can access.

Notes: This post was edited/created using GenAI tools.

Read next: Users Question Google’s AI Overviews After Spam Policy Update
external.title: Google Brings AI-Powered Avatars to Its Video Tool While Opening Access to Casual Users

record.text: it's staggering to me that safeguards were not thought of or implemented in these public use models, which would have them guide users acting suicidal or asking for aid in the process over to crisis and prevention resources.

I'm not keen on the idea of people's privacy being thrown aside either but this process can probably be done in an ethical manner to serve a public good. encouraging / aiding suicide is a felony in all states, and these aren't elderly or terminally ill people seeking to end their pain.

if there's a dramatic spike in suicidality or hospitalization among the people these incidents occurred with, they likely qualify as claimants and can be asked to sign on as such if they are willing to sign a privacy waiver so researchers can read their individual log histories.
